New Records: Kyle Schwarber matched a major league record with his 13th leadoff home run this season, matching Brady Anderson for ninth with 44 leadoff homers. He also hit his 32nd home run of the season, matching Brady Anderson's ninth.
Key Match Events: Kyle Schwarber hit a solo home run in the first inning, extending his streak to 4-for-7 with 6 hits in that span. J.T. Realmuto homered in the ninth inning for the Phillies. Philadelphia swept the two-game series. Bryce Harper was hit on the left elbow by a fastball but stayed in the game. Edmundo Sosa pinch-hit for Harper and took over at third base after Clemens moved to first.
Post-Match Reflections: Philadelphia Phillies manager Rob Thomson praised Kyle Schwarber's performance, calling him'special' and noting his ability to walk and hit. Bryce Harper discussed playing through nagging wrist and elbow issues, stating he isn't convinced it's worth taking days off for rest.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Rogers Centre with a crowd of 23,768. The Phillies had a line of -125 and an over/under of 7.5. The Phillies selected the contract of RHP Nick Nelson and optioned RHP Tyler Phillips to Triple-A. They also designated RHP Michael Rucker for assignment. The Blue Jays will visit Atlanta for their next series starting Friday.
